job.title: Data Engineer
Finance Executive, SG/Group Entity
job.description:
About Xfers
Xfers as a part of Fazz Financial Group portfolio — a holding company of over 10 FinTech startups dedicated to enabling financial access for everyone — is on a mission to provide financial access to millions of underserved communities in Southeast Asia through building a financial ecosystem that anyone can participate in safely. Our range of last-mile financial rails power businesses across Southeast Asia - from startups to family businesses. By removing the pain of setting up and managing digital payments, more business owners can focus on growing their business, in turn encouraging fairer and healthier competition, and fostering stronger, more vibrant economies. For more information, visit: www.xfers.com
But there is much more to do. We know how important our mission is to the improving the livelihoods of millions of people in Southeast Asia, and that's why we're looking for passionate and driven people to join us to accelerate financial access for everyone.

About the role and team 
Finance Executive for SG/Group entity

Responsibilities
  • Ownership and accountability over financial operations and reporting

    • What you may be doing
  • Ensure proper recording and reconciliation of cryptocurrency assets
  • Support merchant operations and liaise with stakeholders on system infrastructure
  • Prepare month end closing for Group i.e. consolidation/allocation/ESOP
  • Assist with annual audit for SG/Group entities

    • What we are looking for in you / Ideal profile
  • Proficiency in use of SAP
  • At least 2-3 years experience with consolidation accounting
  • Strong time management and able to complete tasks on time
  • Strong communication skills to manage internal stakeholders
  • Fast learner and open to learning about new products
  • Diploma or Degree in Accountancy

    • Nice to haves
  • Broad understanding of the Payments and FinTech industry 
    • We love reviewing all the applications we receive, but unfortunately, we may not be able to get back to everyone individually.  If we’d like to move forward with your application, we’ll definitely be in touch!

    Xfers is an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment at Xfers will be considered without regard to race, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

    By submitting your application, you agree that Xfers may collect your personal data for recruiting, regional organization planning, and related purposes.

job.title: Product Manager
job.description:
11:FS is on a mission to change the fabric of financial services. Our Consulting & Research practice builds challenger propositions globally, like we did for Natwest with Mettle. Our Pulse team creates a benchmarking tool used by the likes of Monzo, Starling, Natwest and Tesco Bank. Our Foundry team are delivering a Financial Services Operating System to help businesses quickly add financial services to their offering. On top of all of that, we’re a media company, generating content that supports our brand and changes the conversation - not necessarily in that order.

To do this we need an amazing team so we have pulled together the best in financial services and beyond.

We truly live our values at 11:FS, and they are critical to your entire journey here. ‘Cultural Add’ is as, if not more, important as pure technical fit, and as part of your interview process we’ll deep dive in our values and your beliefs. Everyone at 11:FS fits our 4 core values: Team, Attitude, Communication and Impact, and this remains at the core of our growth.

11:FS has built digital banks and challenger banks around the world and from this experience we are creating 11:FS Foundry. Fintechs or tech companies looking to challenge the status quo often face prohibitive costs of adopting these same old systems, or the daunting task of building something new from scratch. 11:FS Foundry is our financial services operating system, allowing our customers to get financial services propositions to market faster, avoid vendor lock-in and deliver incredible experiences.

We are looking for a Product Manager to join our growing team to help drive the delivery of the foundry platform. Working with our engineering teams, helping shape the roadmap and bringing the product to life.

What you'll be doing: 

Customer insights and development  

You will assist the “Product Lead” on identifying the ‘jobs to be done’ for different end-customer segments, structuring primary and secondary research into insightful proposition ideas and proposals 

Create proposition 

You will develop solutions that bring together a real answer to a customer need, remixing design patterns, understanding what can be built in software, and what the potential business model could be. You'll be exposed to senior decision makers, and will need to communicate these product concepts clearly and concisely. 

Development and test  

You will work together with the best designers, engineers, and clients, to create and develop Foundry’s financial operating product. You will help drive the team that develops those propositions into perfectly formed products, managing the backlog, running ceremonies and ensuring agile principles within the team. 

Roadmap  

You will help shape the roadmap and backlog of work, supporting the team in planning how the product will develop in specific markets.

About you
We are looking for product managers who have worked in a B2B environment - ideally experience working with and building SaaS products. If you had experience working for or with financial service clients or even just a genuine interest in finance and fintech more specifically that would be amazing. That said, it's not a hard requirement.  
You will have good commercial understanding, experience with core product tooling (e.g. JIRA, Figma, Notion or similar) and the ability to communicate exceptionally well.

What we are looking for:
  • Product Management experience ideally in either B2B/SaaS environments.
  • Experience working in a startup environment, happy to get involved in a variety of activities to drive the business forward.
  • Experience working with teams of 5-10, engineers, designers and product people.
  • A good understanding on UI and UX principles.
  • Stakeholder management skills with demonstrable experience in influencing technical teams.
  • Experience driving end-customer interviews and turning these insights into amazing products and services.
  • Experience in or a passion for Fintech.
  • Most importantly a positive attitude and outlook
    • We strongly encourage people of colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. 11:FS is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone to our team. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

    In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

    Unfortunately we are unable to sponsor Visas at this time, but please do check back in with us in the future.

job.title: Affiliate Business Development Manager (Arabic/Eng) - Remote
Research Analyst (Crypto) - Waterdrop
job.location: New York / Seattle / Bay Area / Remote
job.description:
About the Company
Founded in 2018 by professors of Yale University and Columbia University, CertiK is a pioneer in blockchain security and data analytics. CertiK's mission is to secure the cyber world with cutting-edge innovations and insights.  CertiK raised over $60 million from the Series B funding round in 2021. Our investors include top VCs like Tiger Global, Coatue Management, Shunwei Capital, and Hillhouse Capital as well as industry leaders like Coinbase Ventures and Binance.

About You
You’re a self-starter. You believe in tackling the most important problems, even if they are the most difficult problems. You’re comfortable with the unknown and understand that #startuplife means that you’re going to be wearing multiple hats. And that’s what motivates you. You’re accountable and obsessed with improvement, both in yourself and in others. You’re up to the challenge of building a world-class company that aims to be the infrastructure for more secure software for all.

About the Role
As a Research Analyst, you will be focused on analyzing on-chain data for a variety of crypto projects. You will consistently identify high signal trends for crypto users and investors to make informed decisions. You will be working closely with the product and marketing teams as a subject matter expert to create data insights that will serve CertiK’s new and existing user base.

Responsibilities
  • Monitor and analyze on-chain data to discover crypto investment opportunities
  • Identify on-chain metrics and design alert criteria that serve as signals for project growth and adoptionConduct data quality checks to find any abnormalities
  • Participate in community showcases to condense detailed research findings into easily digestible content on a consistent basis
  • Produce high-quality research reports focused on data analysis using CertiK tools Continuously research and learn about new trends and projects within emerging areas (e.g. DeFi, NFTs, Blockchain Gaming)
  • Prepare datasets for data and engineer teams, including manual labeling of wallets and smart contracts
  • Assist product and marketing teams on research-focused content creation

    • Requirements
  • Open to all levels of experience
  • Passionate about crypto - we are looking for people who enjoy learning about new crypto projects and have a pulse on the industry
  • Exceptionally analytical and detail-oriented
  • Ability to dive deep into data to identify investing trends and opportunities
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills - comfortable with writing and translating analytical research into easy to understand insights
  • Self-motivated with the ability to consistently produce results under limited supervision
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment and shift gears based on team needs
  • Ability to juggle multiple projects and independently prioritize initiatives
  • Experience with data analysis tools, such as Excel and SQL, is a plus

job.title: Director, Business Development Operations
Crypto* Talent Acquisition Manager
job.description:
Ledger is the global leader of security solutions and infrastructure for cryptocurrencies and blockchain applications, with more than 3.5 million users in 165 countries. Ledger combines hardware and software expertise to secure billions of dollars worth of almost 2,000 different crypto assets - worldwide, 15% of these assets are managed through the Ledger ecosystem. 

Crypto* means cryptography & cryptocurrency at Ledger, we will recruit a lot in those 2 areas for our innovation team and Product Security - Ledger Donjon.
 
Are you willing to join a company with a startup spirit that is still growing faster?
Motivated by the challenge of recruiting top profiles, scale teams?

Our Stack : LinkedIn Recruiter, Lever, Time, Love ( x repeat)

In full growth, we have an ambitious recruitment plan, meaning a real issue in terms of talent acquisition and onboarding.


Missions:
  • Being responsible of the all recruitment process from sourcing, direct approach, management of applications via ATS, following candidates through their all process to the closing
  • Work on Crypto* recrutements with Technical expert
  • Connecting with Hiring Managers - your internal customers to carry out the closing of your positions in self-reliance to collaborate, engaging regular exchange and collaborate with Hiring Managers
  • Participate in HR improvement projects
  • Developing the visibility and attractiveness of Ledger
  • Ensuring a watch on innovative actions in your field
  • Participate in our referral policy program

    • Requirements:
  • Experience in operational recruitment, ideally in a context of strong growth or on a market where there is a dearth of good engineers
  • Mastering the recruitment process through direct approach
  • Being data driven and monitoring your work with KPIs
  • Willing and able to take a step back from your recruitment activity in order to carry out structuring projects for the talent acquisition activity
  • Having worked in an international context and being comfortable in English (speaking, talking, reading)
  • Understanding the Tech / Dev Open Source & Crypto*/ Blockchain ecosystem

    • Benefits:
  • Competitive compensation package and ESOP according to the Company policy
  • Flexible working hours, remote-friendly environment
  • Strong focus on personal development including internal/external trainings and attendance to conferences, internal talks, technical meetups and Hackathons
  • High performance office equipment
  • Comprehensive health insurance policy offering extensive medical, dental and vision care coverage
  • Meal Vouchers with Swile (ex Lunchr)
  • Annual company outing for Ledgerdary Days, plus frequent parties, snacks and drinks
  • Employee discount on Ledger products
    • Ledger guarantees equity for all during the recruitment process, without any distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age

job.title: Director of Business Development, Memberships
job.description:
Founded in 2018 and based in NYC, The Block is the leading research, analysis, and news brand in the digital asset space. The Block's team is spread across 7 timezones, covering the global cryptocurrency space 24/7.
The Block delivers deep insight into how the emerging digital assets sector interacts with traditional finance, technology, governments, and markets. We reach hundreds of thousands of technologists, financial market participants, Fortune 500 professionals, global service providers, policymakers, and more through our main website, dedicated Research Portal, podcast, and events.
We are currently seeking a Director of Business Development to join our rapidly growing Membership sales team. The Director of Business Development will lead a team of driven Business Development Associates and manage front-line managers on the team. 

The Director of Business Development should bring a proven track record of success in achieving lead and pipeline generation targets and previous experience motivating teams. They will align outbound and inbound lead generation goals, strategy, and tactics to our go-to-market initiatives.  This role will collaborate closely with marketing, sales, and enablement groups to maximize pipeline creation. 

Responsibilities
  • Hire, onboard, and directly manage new Business Development Associates (BDAs) and Account Management Associates (AMAs), who serve as the top-of-the-funnel sales reps focused on qualifying prospects and clients and setting meetings for AEs and AMs, respectively.
  • Set and define the Business Development strategy for inbound and outbound teams
  • Develop your team’s skills for researching, prospecting, qualifying, and pipeline creation
  • Provide regular coaching, feedback, and professional development by utilizing internal sales tools
  • Coach the team on effective sales techniques and product knowledge
  • Closely monitor metrics with the aim to and make recommendations that will increase productivity
  • Collaborate with sales managers and account executives/ managers to ensure proper alignment on account coverage, target personas, meeting quality, and BDA to AE hand-off
  • Work closely with Marketing and Sales leadership to ensure lead quality and quantity to support top of the funnel metrics 
  • Articulate the value proposition of The Block in the market, and maintain in-depth knowledge of our products, our competitors, and industry trends
  • Work closely with Sales leadership to develop career pathways for BDAs and AMAs
  • Track and report on team progress to monthly and quarterly goals for lead conversion, initial sales meetings, and pipeline sourced

    • Qualifications
  • 3+ years managing a team of Business Development Associates, preferably in a B2B SaaS sales environment
  • Second-line management experience
  • Proven record of meeting and exceeding lead conversion, meeting, and pipeline targets Experience working with Marketing and Sales leadership Excellent leadership, interpersonal, communication, and conflict resolution skills
  • Passionate about inspiring and developing team members
  • Expert in using sales tools and products to drive productivity
  • Proven ability to effectively hire and train new BDAsAbility to the culture of intensity around activity and performance
  • An interest in the evolving crypto and digital assets industryImpeccable time management and organizational skills
  • Adaptable to changing startup environment
  • Collaborative spirit and results-oriented

job.title: Recruiter
job.description:
LATOKEN exchange has 2 million accounts including 900k+ users of our Android app rated 4.4 by 25+ thousands of reviews. We leverage the next tech to make account opening as easy as Instagram. The technology and our Olympic sports culture can make us the first billion users digital wallet needed to free people to manage their financial life.

Today, is a great moment to join us as crypto is expanding into mainstream financial market and ex CFO of JP Morgan joined our advisory board and 2 presidents joined us in Davos.

Here is our backlog.

Unit: Talent Growth
Role: Recruiter
Role Mission: Hire Champion-level talents.

Details:

  • Story: Teammates need Champion-level talents to be hired to raise the bar for units and ensure they deliver their objectives.
  • Goal: Successful hires >7 per month.
  • How:
    • Attract candidates via SignalHire, Telegram groups, MIPT, ITMO, Indian University of Technology, contests partnerships, etc.
    • Do 2 batches with cheating game/case per week via Signalhire+Business Quiz=>Calendly invite.
    • Promote LATOKEN brand, screen & interview, bring to offer & close candidates.
  • Conditions: Hires should be crypto-motivated team players.

Main performance number: Offers signed.
Second performance number: Hired above average 360.
Third performance number: Screening Tests.

Functions:

  • Offer & Close : Tie offer features to opportunities & benefits for the candidate to prepare and sell the offer.
  • Find & Research : Build own pipeline of relevant candidates using creative sourcing channels (SignalHire, Telegram groups, MIPT, ITMO, India Universities of Technology, contests partnerships, etc.).
  • Scrum : Participate Stand-ups, Sprints with Demos, Grooming and Retro driven by Stories Who need What, Why.
  • Sell & Attract : Sell LATOKEN jobs and attract talented candidates from top companies.
  • Batches : Fill in 3 batches per week with 21 candidates (participated) selected out of 100 applicants by CV and test scores.
  • Vacancies : Post vacancies in 4 channels with descriptions from roles approved with bar raiser. Candidate profile and role requirements grandma clear with role requirements, keywords, 3 ideal CVs, and SH query.
  • SH blast : Approve SH list of prospects on Team Health meeting with 3 relevant candidates from 100 to 105 in the list. Make email blast and with calendly to batch. Score candidates' CVs and request to pass a test before the batch, otherwise change the batch date.

Requirement skills and experience:

  • 2+ years in recruitment or sales at high-pace international capital markets, fintech, blockchain, or tech companies.
  • Willingness to challenge for overachievement.
  • Prefer growth to comfort.
  • Passion for and understanding of IT and digital currency.
  • Fluent English.

Reward:

  • We give proof that a teammate's life made an impact - LATOKEN share in Nasdaq index and millions in your pockets from vested options.
  • Breakthrough technology and Product - Market - Timing Fit.
  • Worldwide multibillion users market.
  • Join us to build the first digital exchange wallet with a billion users.

Feel a great fit - apply now or forward to a great candidate.

job.title: Lead Product Manager, Signing
job.location: New York, New York; Portland, Oregon; Chicago, Illinois; Los Angeles, California; San Francisco, Cal

job.title: Global Recruitment Manager
Software Engineer, New Grad
job.description:
About Us:
  • We are a full-stack company i.e. we are building both blockchain protocols and the user experiences on top of them
  • We are experienced startup founders and operators
  • We are highly technical, with backgrounds at places like Google and MIT
  • We are mission driven with a big goal: to bring sound currency and property rights to those who need it most
  • We have a strong engineering culture, which values open-source

    • You Will:
  • Implement, test, and audit the stability and/or identity portion of the Celo protocol
  • Work with senior engineers to contribute high level decisions about the Celo protocol and architecture
  • Build back-end services that power our APIs
  • Help to hit product milestones by writing high quality, well tested code
  • Help communicate and implement best practices across the engineering team
  • Author detailed technical specifications
  • Perform and participate in code reviews
  • Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks
  • Work in a high performance scrum team
  • Collaborate with product and design teams

    • You Have:
  • A strong passion for Celo's mission
  • Ability to write high quality, well tested code
  • Ability to grow and adapt to a rapidly evolving technology stack
  • Strong experience developing production software
  • Strong communication skills and ability to lead technical discussions
  • Experience building software that is reusable, extensible, and modular
  • A passion for testing and achieving high test coverage
  • Enthusiasm to work in a startup environment
  • Bonus: Deep understanding or passion for blockchain technology
  • Bonus: Background is distributed systems, cryptography, or programming languages
  • Bonus: Knowledge of Solidity and the EVM

    • What we offer:
  • Competitive salary, equity, and coin plan
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Commuter benefit
  • 401k plan
  • Beautiful office space
    • cLabs ("Celo Labs") started Celo in 2017 and is one of many contributors to the open source project Celo. cLabs builds financial technology to enable prosperity of all beings.

    cLabs is a Teal organization, a method of decentralized management and organizational governance. Roles are defined around the work, not people, and there is a high degree of autonomy. As such, we're all proud to hold the job title of "Partner." For more information on our culture, we encourage you to check out our blog at https://medium.com/celohq/the-future-is-teal-cc264a5d51d3.

    To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

    Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)celo.org. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

job.title: Risk Operation Analyst
job.description:
Description

About Crypto.com

Founded in 2016, Crypto.com today serves over 10 million customers with the world’s fastest growing crypto app, along with the Crypto.com Visa Card — the world’s largest crypto card program — the Crypto.com Exchange and Crypto.com DeFi Wallet. Recently launched, Crypto.com NFT is the premier platform for collecting and trading NFTs, carefully curated from the worlds of art, design, entertainment and sports.

Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO/IEC 27701:2019, CCSS Level 3, ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance, and independently assessed at Tier 4, the highest level for both NIST Cybersecurity and Privacy Frameworks.

With over 2,600 people in offices across the Americas, Europe and Asia, Crypto.com is accelerating the world’s transition to cryptocurrency. Find out more: https://crypto.com

Requirements

Responsibilities

  • Assist in the operation processes related to new product listing, product parameters and model parameters updates.
  • Proactively identify, report and ensure transparency of risks, and immediate escalation of material issues to risk managers.
  • Support risk managers and take a lead in development and automation of risk reporting and analysis.
  • Provide support in handling and reporting data elements to meet regulatory requirements.
  • Assist with documentation of risk reporting procedures and ensure in line with models and methodology documentation.
  • Assist in the daily risk reporting and monitoring of the markets and measuring the risk exposure of market makers' portfolios.

Requirements

  • Educated to undergraduate/master level in Computer Science / Maths or numerate subjects.
  • Rigorous and focus on details, strong logical thinking and reasoning skills
  • Proficient in Python (5 years of working experience) and SQL or noSQL data structure/ data model and database management. Working experience with time-series data, Pandas, Flask, Numpy is a must.
  • Keen to develop and apply understanding of risk principles – Initial Margin, VaR, collateral haircuts, stress testing, back testing, liquidity stress testing.
  • Experience related to Financial/ Risk management; exchange/clearing house risk management experience is a plus.
  • Knowledge of crypto market, corporate action events and their impacts on the pricing adjustment is a plus
  • Highly proficient written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to coordinate within teams across businesses.
  • Analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Passionate about cryptocurrency and blockchain.

Benefits

  • We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech.
  • Huge responsibilities from Day 1.
  • Be the owner of your own learning curve.
  • The possibilities are limitless and depend on you
  • You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team
  • You will get to have involvement in developing a brand new product from scratch alongside with a talented team

job.title: Blockchain/Solidity Developer (Codefi)
Full Stack Web Developer
Senior Backend Developer (Remote)
Crypto Research Analyst
job.description:
About Kraken

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade, Kraken has risen to become one of the largest, most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet. 

We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank, providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter. 

Our diverse group of 2,000+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture, united by a shared passion for delighting customers, upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve, are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential. 

Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and we’re just getting started. We’re growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution!

About the role

Kraken’s legal team works cross-functionally across the company, focusing on key new product initiatives at the bleeding edge intersection of decentralized systems and the law. As a Crypto Research Analyst, you will drive the diligence process for Kraken’s new asset listings, as well as support reviews for new staking services, parachain auctions and other special projects. This role sits within the Legal department - however, no legal training or qualification is required.

This is a fully remote role.

Responsibilities
  • Conduct technical, corporate, and market-based research on crypto projects in connection with our asset listing process
  • Liaise directly with crypto project teams
  • Communicate your findings to members of Kraken’s Legal team through oral and written reports 
  • Analyze primary source material such as whitepapers, Github repos, and block explorers
  • Monitor network progress and developments, including forks, network upgrades, and consensus changes
  • Manage a robust, multi-faceted review pipeline, ensuring deadlines are consistently met

    • Requirements
  • Experience in the crypto industry, or demonstrable passion for and knowledge of crypto-native projects and protocols
  • Strong written and oral communication skills - including the ability to translate complex technical concepts and industry terminology so that people across the organization can understand it 
  • Keen attention to detail, and a commitment to quality
  • Project management skills requisite to process multiple projects simultaneously 
  • A team player who works collaboratively with various functions across the company 
  • Bachelor’s degree and 2-4 years of work experience  
  • Nice to have:  meaningful experience with computer science, software engineering, or operating a crypto side project
    • Location Tagging: #US #EU

    We’re powered by people from around the world with their own unique and diverse experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives, regardless of their background. 

    As an equal opportunity employer we don’t tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws. 

    Check out all our open roles at https://www.kraken.com/careers.  

    Stay in the know

    Follow us on Twitter
    Catch up on our blog
    Follow us on LinkedIn

job.title: Account Manager
Head of Product Marketing
Market Data Systems Engineer
Software Engineer
job.location: Berkeley - also open to remote in US
